apikey.description: Key used to authentication to the CloudAMQP Customer API

baseurl.description: Base URL to CloudAMQP Customer website

enable_faster_instance_destroy.description: Skips destroying backend resources on 'terraform destroy'

action.description: The action to perform on the node

block.description: Preform actions on your CloudAMQP account, such as rotating passwords or API keys.

message_type.description: Message types (total, unacked, ready) of the queue to trigger the alarm

queue_regex.description: Regex for which queues to check

recipients.description: Identifiers for recipients to be notified.

reminder_interval.description: The reminder interval (in seconds) to resend the alarm if not resolved. Set to 0 for no reminders. The Default is 0.

time_threshold.description: For how long (in seconds) the value_threshold should be active before trigger alarm

type.description: Type of the alarm, valid options are: cpu, memory, disk_usage, queue_length, connection_count, consumers_count, net_split

value_calculation.description: Disk value threshold calculation. Fixed or percentage of disk space remaining

value_threshold.description: What value to trigger the alarm for

vhost_regex.description: Regex for which vhost the queues are in

allow_downtime.description: When resizing disk, allow cluster downtime to do so

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for resizing the disk

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for resizing the disk

apikey.description: API key for the CloudAMQP instance

backend.description: Software backend used, determined by subscription plan

dedicated.description: Is the instance hosted on a dedicated server

host.description: External hostname for the CloudAMQP instance

host_internal.description: Internal hostname for the CloudAMQP instance

keep_associated_vpc.description: Keep associated VPC when deleting instance

no_default_alarms.description: Set to true to not create default alarms

nodes.description: Number of nodes in cluster (plan must support it)

plan.description: Name of the plan, see documentation for valid plans

preferred_az.description: Preferred availability zone for the instance(s), one entry per node in the cluster

ready.description: Flag describing if the resource is ready

region.description: Name of the region you want to create your instance in

tags.description: Tag the instances with optional tags

vpc_id.description: The ID of the VPC to create your instance in

vpc_subnet.description: Dedicated VPC subnet, shouldn't overlap with your current VPC's subnet

settings.description: Settings to be copied. [alarms, config, definitions, firewall, logs, metrics, plugins]

subscription_id.description: Instance identifier of the CloudAMQP instance to copy settings from

aws_account_id.description: The 12 digit AWS Account ID where you want the events to be sent to.

aws_region.description: The AWS region where you the events to be sent to. (e.g. us-west-1, us-west-2, ..., etc.)

prefetch.description: Number of messages to prefetch. Default set to 1.

queue.description: A (durable) queue on your RabbitMQ instance.

status.description: Always set to null, unless there is an error starting the EventBridge

vhost.description: The VHost the queue resides in.

with_headers.description: Include message headers in the event data.

api_key.description: The API key for the integration service. (Datadog)

application.description: The name of the application. (Azure Monitor)

endpoint.description: The syslog destination to send the logs to. (Papertrail)

private_key.description: The private API key used for authentication. (Stackdriver, Coralogix)

project_id.description: The project ID for the integration service. (Stackdriver)

region.description: The region hosting integration service. (Cloudwatch, Datadog)

retention.description: The number of days to retain logs. (Cloudwatch)

sourcetype.description: Assign source type to the data exported, eg. generic_single_line. (Splunk)

subsystem.description: The name of the subsystem. (Azure Monitor)

table.description: The table name to send the logs to. (Azure Monitor)

token.description: The token used for authentication. (Loggly, Logentries, Splunk, Scalyr)

url.description: The URL to push the logs to. (Papertrail)

api_key.description: The API key for the integration service. (Librato, Data Dog, New Relic)

email.description: The email address registred for the integration service. (Librato)

iam_external_id.description: External identifier that match the role you created. (Cloudwatch)

iam_role.description: The ARN of the role to be assumed when publishing metrics. (Cloudwatch)

id.description: Resource ID of the integration metric

region.description: AWS region for Cloudwatch and [US/EU] for Data dog/New relic. (Cloudwatch, Data Dog, New Relic)

metrics_filter.description: List of metrics to include. If not specified, default metrics are used. See https://www.cloudamqp.com/docs/monitoring_metrics_splunk_v2.html#metrics-filtering for more information

iam_external_id.description: External identifier that matches the role you created.

iam_role.description: AWS IAM role ARN with PutMetricData permission

rabbitmq_dashboard_metrics_format.description: Enable metric name transformation to match Datadog's RabbitMQ dashboard format

region.description: Datadog region; us1, us3, us5, or eu1

access_token.description: Dynatrace access token with 'Ingest metrics' permission

client_email.description: Google service account client email (computed from credentials file)

credentials_file.description: Base64-encoded Google service account key JSON file

private_key.description: Google service account private key (computed from credentials file)

private_key_id.description: Google service account private key ID (computed from credentials file)

project_id.description: Google Cloud project ID (computed from credentials file)

preferred_day.description: Preferred day of the week when to run maintenance

preferred_time.description: Preferred time (UTC) the day when to run maintenance

action.description: The action to perform on the node

name.description: Optional display name of the recipient

type.description: Type of the notification, valid options are: email, opsgenie, opsgenie-eu,pagerduty, slack, signl4, teams, victorops, webhook

value.description: Notification endpoint, where to send the notifcation

type.description: Responder type, valid options are: team, user, escalation, schedule

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for OAuth2 configuration

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for OAuth2 configuration

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

active_zones.description: Covering availability zones used when creating an Endpoint from other VPC

allowed_principals.description: Allowed principals to access the endpoint service

service_name.description: Service name of the PrivateLink, needed when creating the endpoint

sleep.description: Configurable sleep in seconds between retries when enable PrivateLink

status.description: Status of the PrivateLink [enabled, pending, disabled]

timeout.description: Configurable timeout in seconds when enable PrivateLink

approved_subscriptions.description: Approved subscriptions to access the endpoint service

server_name.description: Name of the server having the PrivateLink enabled

service_name.description: Service name (alias) of the PrivateLink, needed when creating the endpoint

sleep.description: Configurable sleep in seconds between retries when enable PrivateLink

status.description: Status of the PrivateLink [enabled, pending, disabled]

timeout.description: Configurable timeout in seconds when enable PrivateLink

channel_max.description: Set the maximum permissible number of channels per connection. 0 means no limit.

cluster_partition_handling.description: Set how the cluster should handle network partition.

connection_max.description: Set the maximum permissible number of connections, -1 means infinity.

consumer_timeout.description: A consumer that has received a message and does not acknowledge that message within the timeout in milliseconds.

heartbeat.description: Set the server AMQP 0-9-1 heartbeat timeout in seconds.

log_exchange_level.description: Log level for the logger used for log integrations and the CloudAMQP Console log view.

max_message_size.description: The largest allowed message payload size in bytes.

queue_index_embed_msgs_below.description: Size in bytes below which to embed messages in the queue index. 0 will turn off payload embedding in the queue index.

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for RabbitMQ configuration

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for RabbitMQ configuration

vm_memory_high_watermark.description: When the server will enter memory based flow-control as relative to the maximum available memory.

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for firewall configuration

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for firewall configuration

ip.description: CIDR address: IP address with CIDR notation (e.g. 10.56.72.0/24)

new_version.description: The new version to upgrade to

current_version.description: Helper argument to change upgrade behaviour to latest possible version

new_version.description: The new version to upgrade to

id.description: Resource ID of the VPC instance

region.description: Region where the VPC is located

subnet.description: The VPC subnet in CIDR notation (e.g., 10.56.72.0/24)

tags.description: Optional tags to associate with the VPC instance

vpc_name.description: VPC name given when hosted at the cloud provider

active_zones.description: Covering availability zones used when creating an endpoint from other VPC. [AWS]

allowed_principals.description: List of allowed prinicpals used by AWS

allowed_projects.description: List of allowed projects used by GCP

approved_subscriptions.description: List of approved subscriptions used by Azure

region.description: The region where the CloudAMQP instance is hosted

service_name.description: Service name (alias for Azure) of the PrivateLink.

sleep.description: Configurable sleep in seconds between retries when enable PrivateLink

status.description: Status of the Private Service Connect [enabled, pending, disabled]

timeout.description: Configurable timeout in seconds when enable PrivateLink

sleep.description: Configurable sleep in seconds between retries when requesting or reading peering

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time (seconds) before retries times out

wait_on_peering_status.description: Wait until peering status change to 'connected'

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for accepting or removing peering

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for accepting or removing peering

concurrency.description: How many times the request will be made if previous call fails

queue.description: The queue that should be forwarded, must be a durable queue!

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for webhook

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for webhook

vhost.description: The name of the virtual host

webhook_uri.description: A POST request will be made for each message in the queue to this endpoint

queue_regex.description: Regex for which queues to check

recipients.description: Identifiers for recipients to be notified.

reminder_interval.description: The reminder interval (in seconds) to resend the alarm if not resolved. Set to 0 for no reminders

time_threshold.description: For how long (in seconds) the value_threshold should be active before trigger alarm

value_calculation.description: Disk value threshold calculation. Fixed or percentage of disk space remaining

value_threshold.description: What value to trigger the alarm for

vhost_regex.description: Regex for which vhost the queues are in

apikey.description: API key for the CloudAMQP instance

backend.description: Software backend used, determined by subscription plan

dedicated.description: Is the instance hosted on a dedicated server

host.description: External hostname for the CloudAMQP instance

host_internal.description: Internal hostname for the CloudAMQP instance

no_default_alarms.description: If default alarms set or not for the instance

nodes.description: Number of nodes in cluster (plan must support it)

plan.description: Name of the plan, see documentation for valid plans

ready.description: Flag describing if the resource is ready

region.description: Name of the region you want to create your instance in

tags.description: Tag the instances with optional tags

vpc_id.description: The ID of the VPC to create your instance in

vpc_subnet.description: Dedicated VPC subnet, shouldn't overlap with your current VPC's subnet

name.description: Optional display name of the recipient

type.description: Type of the notification, valid options are: email, webhook, pagerduty, victorops, opsgenie, opsgenie-eu, slack

value.description: Notification endpoint, where to send the notifcation

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

sleep.description: Configurable sleep in seconds between retries when reading peering
